title: Blinken Hears Stories of Horror From Survivors of the Hamas Attack
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken embraced survivors of the deadly attacks by Hamas in Israel during his visit to Tel Aviv on Thursday, as the top US diplomat sought to demonstrate the depth of the Biden administration’s commitment in the wake of the massacre.

title: Ballot Eve:  Australia Briefing
description: Good morning it’s Georgie here in Sydney. Here’s what you need to know today...Today’s must-reads:• Australia’s ‘Voice’ vote Saturday faces defeat • What you need to know about the NZ election• The latest on Israel

title: Assessing Crypto’s Role in Illicit Financing
description: test

title: Biden Meets With CEOs on Economy as Inflation Stays Hot
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Justin Sink looks at President Joe Biden’s meeting with chief executives about the economy. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Top House Republican Wants Help From Democrats to Pick a Speaker
description: A powerful Republican is looking to Democrats to help resolve his party’s impasse over naming a speaker of the House.

title: Chile Finance Minister Downplays Inflation Risks From Currency Slump
description: Chile’s finance minister played down the impact of one of the world’s worst currency routs on inflation, saying the short-term peso weakness is unlikely to divert the central bank’s plans to cut interest rates.

title: US Gives First Iron Dome Interceptors to Israel
description: The Pentagon has transferred to Israel the first missiles in US inventories for the Iron Dome air-defense system to intercept Hamas rockets, according to a US defense official.

title: US and Qatar Will Hold Off Giving Iran $6 Billion in Funds
description: The US reached an informal understanding with Qatar to hold off distributing $6 billion in oil revenue that Iran was allowed to access under a prisoner exchange, as the Biden administration probes Tehran’s potential involvement in last week’s Hamas attack against Israel.

title: Australia’s Indigenous Vote Faces Defeat After Divisive Campaign
description: Australia is poised to reject a proposal to establish an Indigenous advisory body to Parliament at a national referendum, in a blow to the standing of Prime Minister Anthony Albanese’s center-left government.

title: US to Offer Charter Flights for Citizens Seeking to Leave Israel
description: The US government will begin offering charter flights to transport American citizens and immediate family members who are seeking to leave Israel after the deadly attack by Hamas, National Security Council spokesman John Kirby said.

title: Talk of War Dominates Annual Gathering of Global Finance Chiefs
description: War in the Middle East has swollen the list of geopolitical risks for global finance chiefs already confronting fallout from conflict in Ukraine and bracing for a year of pivotal elections.

title: Bob Menendez Faces New Charge of Acting as a Foreign Agent
description: US Senator Robert Menendez faces a new criminal charge of conspiring to act as an unregistered foreign agent of Egypt, in a revised indictment that expands on criminal charges accusing the Democrat of bribery.

title: Sunak Announces £3m Extra to Protect British Jewish Community After Hamas Attack
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has announced £3 million in extra funding to protect schools, synagogues and other Jewish community buildings in the UK in response to Hamas' attacks in Israel.

title: G-7 Condemns Hamas Attack and Pledges Solidarity With Israel
description: Photographer: Mahmud Hams/AFP

title: Kevin McCarthy Casts Doubt on Steve Scalise’s Speaker Chances
description: Former Speaker Kevin McCarthy cast significant doubt on whether his former No. 2, Majority Leader Steve Scalise, can pull off a win to become speaker as the Louisiana Republican remains far below the vote threshold required to take the House’s top job.

title: Five Things to Watch for in New Zealand’s Election
description: New Zealanders vote on Saturday in the 2023 election, with concerns about the soaring cost of living dominating the campaign.

title: Top House Republican Demands SEC Turn Over Documents on ESG
description: A top House Republican is threatening to subpoena the Securities and Exchange Commission for any documents about US involvement in crafting European Union environmental, social and governance regulations that GOP lawmakers say harm American businesses.

title: Latvia to Shut Last EU Land Crossing to Russia for Ukrainians
description: Latvia said it’s closing a border crossing point that Russia announced would be the sole entry point for most Ukrainians arriving from the European Union by land.

title: Zambia Signs Debt Deal With Creditors, IMF’s Georgieva Says
description: Zambia signed a long-awaited agreement to reorganize its loans with official creditors, co-led by China and France, International Monetary Fund Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva said Thursday.

title: All About the Gaza Strip, the Palestinian Enclave Where Hamas Rules
description: Since the militant Islamist group Hamas took control of Gaza in 2007, the small, overcrowded enclave has been the focal point in Israel’s military conflict with the Palestinians. On Oct. 7, Hamas militants in Gaza pulled off a shocking air, sea and land invasion of southern Israel, killing more than 1,200 people, mostly civilians, and taking at least 97 hostages. Israeli retaliatory strikes on Gaza killed more than 1,300 people, and Israel’s military ordered a “full siege” of the territory. Prim

title: US Trade Data Overstates Decoupling From China, Report Says
description: The US’ reduction in its import dependence on China is less than official figures indicate, according to research looking at under-invoicing and trade rerouting.

title: Data And Wartime Diplomacy
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Tunisia Returns €60 Million in EU Aid as Migration Spat Simmers
description: Tunisia wired a tranche of €60 million ($63.7 million) in financial support back to the European Union after tensions escalated on a deal to manage migration from North Africa.

title: Israel Says 97 People Confirmed So Far as Taken Hostage to Gaza
description: Israel’s military said it has confirmed that at least 97 people were taken as hostages when Hamas attacked southern towns and communities on Saturday.

title: Israel-Hamas War Repeats the Cycle of Violence
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Most Japanese Companies Pessimistic on China’s Economy
description: Japanese companies in China see the economic situation as grim, according to a new report from the Japanese Chamber of Commerce and Industry in China released Thursday.

title: Brutal Attack Shifts Israel From Managing Hamas to Destroying It
description: For 16 years, Israeli governments worked to manage the Hamas leaders in Gaza, not topple them. The Islamist group rejected Israel’s existence and engaged in violence, but kept order over the territory. Hamas was better than chaos.

title: IBM, Target, Exelon Chiefs Are Among CEOs Meeting Biden on Economy
description: President Joe Biden will huddle with chief executives from large firms to discuss economic conditions and efforts to roll out his infrastructure, climate and manufacturing initiatives during a meeting Thursday at the White House.

title: Europe’s Weak Economy Faces Inflation, Oil Risks, Gentiloni Says
description: Paolo Gentiloni, economy commissioner of the European Union (EU), speaks during a Bloomberg Television interview at the annual meetings of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and World Bank in Marrakesh, Morocco, on Thursday, Oct. 12, 2023. The IMF and World Bank’s first annual meetings in Africa since 1973 were expected to give a spending boost to Morocco’s fourth-largest city and one of its top tourist destinations.

title: IMF Latest: G-7 Condems Hamas, War Clouds Global Economy Outlook
description: Finance ministers from the world’s most advanced economies condemned Hamas for its attack against Israel, as war in the Middle East added to the threats facing the global economy.

title: Egypt, IMF Seek to Set Date for Mission on Delayed Review
description: The International Monetary Fund said it’s in “close engagement” with Egypt to set the dates to discuss a much-delayed review of a $3 billion rescue program, citing recent progress on reforms.

title: Italy’s Meloni to Delay Africa Summit Due to Israel-Hamas War
description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni is set to delay until early next year a summit with African leaders, aimed at strengthening cooperation on issues including energy and migration, because of the conflict between Israel and Hamas.

title: Hollywood Studios, Striking Actors in Standoff as Talks Crumble
description: Negotiations between Hollywood studios and the SAG-AFTRA actors’ union have been suspended amid disagreements in key areas like pay, dashing hopes that the months-long labor dispute will soon end.

title: Israel Targets All Hamas Leaders Across Gaza in Fresh War Effort
description: Israel is targeting Hamas’ political leaders in Gaza as well as military ones as it seeks to crush the Palestinian group that launched a brutal attack on its civilians last weekend, military spokesman Lieutenant Colonel Richard Hecht said.

title: Finland Sees Russia Escalating Moves Against It After NATO Entry
description: Finland’s security service expects more influencing operations from neighboring Russia after the Nordic country joined NATO, with the Kremlin seen focusing on information gathering in the cyber environment.

title: Saudi, Iranian Leaders Hold Rare Call to Discuss Israel-Hamas War
description: Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince and de facto ruler Mohammed bin Salman discussed the war between Israel and Hamas in a call with Iran’s president, the first such conversation between the two leaders who normalized relations earlier this year.

title: China Invited Pentagon Chief to Defense Forum, Reuters Says
description: The US has accepted China’s invitation to attend a top annual security forum in Beijing this month, according to Reuters, a sign ties between the world’s two-largest economies are starting to normalize.

title: Canada Official Won’t Attend G-20 Event in India This Week
description: The speaker of Canada’s senate won’t be attending a Group of 20 event hosted by India this week as diplomatic relations between the two countries remain tense.

title: Ireland’s Budget Breaks Spending Rules, Central Bank Chief Says
description: The Irish government’s decision to break its spending rules for a giveaway budget may drive up inflation and risk damaging investment in the country, according to central bank chief Gabriel Makhlouf.

title: Musk’s X Rebuffs Accusations of Israel-Hamas War Disinformation
description: Elon Musk’s X said it scrubbed or labeled tens of thousands of posts including “illegal” content since the Israel-Hamas war erupted, responding to warnings to stem the spread of fake news around the conflict.

title: Ukraine Recap: Russian Drones Shot Down, NATO Ministers Meet
description: Ukrainian air defense shot down 28 out of 33 Shahed drones sent by Russia overnight. The drones came from the Belgorod region in the north and from occupied Crimea in the south, the Ukrainian air force command said on Telegram. Drones damaged port infrastructure near Izmail in the south as well as residential buildings.

title: US Raises Travel Advisory Level on Israel Over Threat of Attacks
description: The US raised its travel advisory for Israel and West Bank to the second highest level, warning citizens to “reconsider” going to the area, citing the threat of terrorist attacks.

title: Japan to Seek Dissolution of Church Cited in Abe’s Killing
description: Japan’s government will ask a court to order the disbandment of the fringe religious group whose activities were cited as motivating the assassination of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe.

title: Israel Latest: Gaza Ground Offensive Looms, More Than 2,400 Dead
description: Israel vowed to wipe Hamas “off the face of the Earth” as its new unity government signaled a major ground offensive soon. The assault by the militant group since the weekend has killed some 1,200 people in Israel. In Gaza, at least 1,200 people have been killed in reprisal attacks.

title: China and India Agree to Maintain Peace Along Disputed Border
description: China and India agreed to maintain peace along their common border in the 20th round of talks between the neighbors on the worst dispute over the issue in 20 years.

title: South Korean President Suffers Setback in Seoul Election
description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol was dealt a blow when a candidate from his conservative party lost a hotly contested election in Seoul that was seen as a gauge for support of his government ahead of national elections in April.

title: Pro-Putin Propaganda Flows Onto Android via Google Loophole
description: Mobile users in Russia are being served pro-war propaganda from sources Google has blocked elsewhere.

title: Macron and Scholz Are Paddling in Opposite Directions
description: Reconciling France and Germany will need 50 trips along the Elbe, not one.

title: Stubbornly High Interest Rates Risk Squeezing the Life Out of UK Companies
description: The UK is facing a “double whammy” as higher-for-longer interest rates begin to bite, with the country particularly vulnerable to a pullback in consumer spending and knock on consequences for corporate debt.

title: DeSantis Lashes Out at Trump Over His Remarks on Israel
description: Donald Trump is drawing criticism from Ron DeSantis, a rival for the Republican presidential nomination, over comments on Israel days after the bloody assault by Hamas.

title: Hollywood’s Ari Emanuel Says Israel’s Netanyahu Needs to Go
description: Hollywood superagent Ari Emanuel, a prominent member of Los Angeles’ Jewish community, called for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to step down, saying he left the country vulnerable to last weekend’s slaughter of civilians by Hamas.

title: China Middle East Envoy Expected to Speak to Israel on Thursday
description: China’s special envoy on Middle East issues is expected to speak Thursday with Israeli officials, according to Israel’s Ambassador to China.

title: Canada Allegations Haven’t Hurt India’s Diplomacy, Envoy Says
description: Allegations that India’s government was involved in the killing of a Sikh separatist leader in Canada have barely affected the South Asian nation’s diplomacy in the Indo-Pacific, according to High Commissioner to Australia Manpreet Vohra.

title: EU Top Diplomat Set For Tense Talks in China After Israel Attack
description: The European Union’s top diplomat has waited all year for the right moment to visit China. Now, he’s finally arriving with the differences between Brussels and Beijing looking larger than ever.

title: Don’t Fall for Xi’s Concession Trap, Academic Warns Albanese
description: Australian leader Anthony Albanese should beware of accepting concessions from China for actions that the world’s no.2 economy simply “shouldn’t have done” in the first place.

title: Republican Divisions Threaten Scalise’s Ascent to House Speaker
description: Republican Steve Scalise faces a fight to become House speaker that could drag on for days or even weeks, delaying the US response to fiscal deadlines and a new war in the Middle East.
